BiblioData.Title: NANOPARTICLE COUPLED TO WAVEGUIDE
BiblioData.Abstract: A nanoparticle (110) is able to emit a single photons. A waveguide (150) is coupled to the nanoparticle (110) and able to receive the single photons. A backreflector (130) is optically coupled to the waveguide (150) and configured to reflect the single photons toward the waveguide (150).

Claims.P: 1. A device comprising: a nanoparticle able to emit single photons; . a waveguide coupled to the nanoparticle and able to receive the single photons; and a backreflector optically coupled to the waveguide and configured to reflect the single photons toward the waveguide.
2. The device as set forth in claim 1 wherein the waveguide is a photonic crystal fiber.
3.. The device as set forth in claim 1 , wherein the backreflector is at least partially transparent at an excitation frequency for exciting the nanoparticle.

4. The .device as set forth in claim 4, further comprising: an optical fiber coupled to the waveguide, and able to direct a pulse through the waveguide toward the nanoparticle at the excitation frequency.

5. The device as set forth in claim 4, further comprising: a lens optically coupled to the backreflector, and able to direct a pulse through the backreflector toward the nanoparticle at the excitation frequency.

6. A method for suppressing leaky modes in photon transmission, comprising: coupling a nanoparticle to an end of a waveguide, and coupling a backreflector to the end of the waveguide behind the nanoparticle.
7. The method of claim 6 further comprising: exciting the nanoparticle to emit a single photon, reflecting the single photon toward a waveguide, and guiding the photon through the waveguide.
8. The method of claim 7 wherein exciting the nanoparticle further comprises directing an optical pulse through the waveguide toward the nanoparticle.
9. The method of claim 7 wherein exciting the nanoparticle further comprises directing an optical pulse through the backreflector toward the nanoparticle.

10. A device comprising: quantum photon emitting means able to emit single photons; photon guiding means coupled to the emitting means and able to receive the single photons; and photon reflecting means optically coupled to the photon guiding means and configured to reflect the single photons toward the photon guiding means.
